statements.name: PROC HPFRECONCILE
statements.description: invokes the HPFRECONCILE procedure. The following options can be used in the PROC HPFRECONCILE statement
statements.help:
PROC HPFRECONCILE  options;                 
	AGGBY  variables;                 
	AGGDATA <options>;                 
	BY  variables <NOTSORTED>;                 
	DISAGGDATA <options>;                 
	ID  variable INTERVAL=interval </options>;

arguments.name: AGGDATA=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the SAS data set that contains the forecasts of the aggregated time series data

arguments.name: CONSTRAINT=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the SAS data set that contains the constraints for the reconciled series

arguments.name: DISAGGDATA
arguments.description: specifies the name of the SAS data set that contains the forecast of the disaggregated time series data

arguments.name: FORCECONSTRAINT
arguments.description: specifies whether the user-specified constraints should be forced on the PREDICT variable in the OUTFOR= data set when the problem is infeasible because the constraints are incompatible with the aggregation constraint

arguments.name: OUTFOR=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the output SAS data set that contains the reconciled values

arguments.name: OUTINFEASIBLE=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the SAS data set that contains a summary of the nodes for which reconciliation failed because of a conflict between the constraints imposed by the user and the aggregation constraint

arguments.name: OUTPROCINFO=
arguments.description: names the output data set to contain the summary information of the processing done by PROC { }

arguments.name: RECDIFF
arguments.description: If the RECDIFF option is specified, the OUTFOR= data sets will contain a variable named RECDIFF that is the difference between the reconciled forecasts and the original forecasts

arguments.name: ERRORTRACE=
arguments.description: specifies how often the error and warning messages should be printed to the log

arguments.name: AGGREGATE=
arguments.description: specifies whether the dependent variable in the AGGDATA= data set is the total sum or the average over the BY groups of the dependent variable in the DISAGGDATA= data set

arguments.name: ALPHA=
arguments.description: specifies the level of the confidence limits when CLMETHOD=GAUSSIAN

arguments.name: CLMETHOD=
arguments.description: specifies the method used to compute confidence limits for the reconciled forecasts

arguments.name: DIRECTION=
arguments.description: specifies the reconciliation direction

arguments.name: DISAGGREGATION=
arguments.description: specifies the type of loss function for top-down reconciliation

arguments.name: IGNOREMISSF
arguments.description: specifies that {.F} missing values in the PREDICT variable be treated as regular {.} missing values

arguments.name: LOCKZERO
arguments.description: specifies that zero values of the PREDICT variable in the DISAGGDATA= data be considered locked equalities

arguments.name: MAXITER=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of predictor-corrector iterations performed by the interior point algorithm

arguments.name: PREDICTONLY
arguments.description: specifies that only the predicted value be reconciled

arguments.name: SIGN=
arguments.description: specifies the sign constraint on the reconciled series

arguments.name: STDMETHOD=
arguments.description: specifies the method used to compute standard errors for the reconciled forecasts

arguments.name: STDDIFBD=
arguments.description: specifies a positive number that defines boundaries for the percentage difference between the original standard error and the reconciled standard error

arguments.name: WEIGHTED
arguments.description: specifies that the loss function for top-down reconciliation be weighted by the inverse of the variance of the input forecasts

statements.name: AGGBY
statements.description: When DIRECTION=BU and the AGGDATA= data set is not specified, the AGGBY statement can be used to specify the AGGBY variables, which is a proper subset of the BY variables that should appear in the OUTFOR= data set

statements.name: AGGDATA
statements.description: enables the user to specify custom names for forecasting variables in the AGGDATA= data set

arguments.name: ACTUAL=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the variable in the AGGDATA= data set that contains the actual values

arguments.name: PREDICT=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the variable in the AGGDATA= data set that contains the predicted values

arguments.name: LOWER=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the variable in the AGGDATA= data set that contains the lower confidence limit values

arguments.name: UPPER=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the variable in the AGGDATA= data set that contains the upper confidence limit values

arguments.name: ERROR=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the variable in the AGGDATA= data set that contains the error values

arguments.name: STD=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the variable in the AGGDATA= data set that contains the standard error values. {Options}

statements.name: BY
statements.description: defines separate groups of observations for the DISAGGDATA= data set

statements.name: DISAGGDATA
statements.description: enables you to specify names for forecasting variables in the DISAGGDATA= data set

arguments.name: ACTUAL=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the variable in the DISAGGDATA= data set that contains the actual values

arguments.name: PREDICT=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the variable in the DISAGGDATA= data set that contains the predicted values

arguments.name: LOWER=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the variable in the DISAGGDATA= data set that contains the lower confidence limit values

arguments.name: UPPER=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the variable in the DISAGGDATA= data set that contains the upper confidence limit values

arguments.name: ERROR=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the variable in the DISAGGDATA= data set that contains the error values

arguments.name: STD=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the variable in the DISAGGDATA= data set that contains the standard error values

arguments.name: BYVARSSORTED
arguments.description: specifies that the DISAGGDATA= data set be sorted by the BY variables

statements.name: ID
statements.description: names a numeric variable that identifies observations in the input and output data sets

arguments.name: ALIGN=
arguments.description: controls the alignment of SAS dates used to identify output observations

arguments.name: END=
arguments.description: specifies a SAS date, datetime, or time value that represents the date at which the reconciliation should end

arguments.name: FORMAT=
arguments.description: specifies a SAS format used for the DATE variable in the output data sets

arguments.name: INTERVAL=
arguments.description: specifies the frequency of the input time series

arguments.name: IRREGULAR
arguments.description: specifies whether to allow for irregularities in the ID variable frequency

arguments.name: START=
arguments.description: specifies a SAS date, datetime, or time value that represents the time ID value at which the reconciliation should begin
